content.label: Can you make the type visible to people who are over 40? Asking for a friend.

title.label: Seems fun, but is a grind fest

content.label: Game has a lot going for it; the smiths and hero’s can level up, you can explore for relics/enchantments, and a lot of neat little touches like boosting equipment, a dog to feed, etc... in the end (30min later), it became a grind fest. Very, VERY repetitive . Was hoping for more depth but beyond the initial appeal, this game falls flat.

This game is good its the best out of all 3 but, i don't like having the risk of starting all the way over 
I haven't played this in a while but it is great maybe add a fighting mode to test your weapons. I hate to start over still though.

So this is clearly ripped straight from the PC version. However doing it that way for a smart phone has made it a cluttered mess when it comes to UI/menus. This is my only complaint, if this is fixed I would love to give it 5 stars.

THOUGHTS
I’ve been playing this for close to 11 hours now I’m on the third area, it’s very addicting and fun if you enjoy micromanagement and resource management but without aggressive micro-transactions. The characters are fun and the weapons are very cool. It feels satisfying to make weapons and the game is a challenge to keep your funds flowing. It’s by no means hard (yet) unless you make a bad decision. 
——-
FEEDBACK 
Only problems I have are 
The overall display of Menus is a bit much it’s kind of overwhelming maybe give the option to minimize them or disable them all together such as the feedback chat from hero’s and smiths and such. Also having your Smith’s go out and do something and having to place them back in their spot everytime is incredibly annoying. I would love for this be changed. It’s becoming more tedious as I have 8 smiths now and placing all of them back in their original spots is tedious and unneeded feature. 

—-
Conclusion (in my opinion) 
The game is great and one of the best ports I’ve seen let alone the fact it’s cheap compared to on console or pc, it’s a fun pocket game and I kill many boring hours I have nothing to do with it I recommend spending the money on it and I will be picking up the other “Holy potatoes!” Titles shortly.

I downloaded out of curiosity. When I was enchanting it said swish & flick and I got so pumped about Harry Potter. The game is super fun and Love it. Before I downloaded it I was upset that the spy story couldn’t be downloaded on my device, but I was not let down.
I just started playing today and it is very fun. Even though, it is kind of complicated it is still addicting.
I have absolutely no idea what it wants me to do to progress.  It’s telling me about multiple weapons but I just can’t activate them.

The game is great, it’s addicting creating various weapons but before a game over it auto saves but after the game over you go to the auto save and it’s the beginning of the day and that does not give you enough time to forge another weapon to sell so your stuck in an endless loop of trying to make a weapon and then a game over happens so you go to the latest save but there isn’t enough time to make a weapon. That I think needs to be fixed.

I have enough to unlock thick gravy-and, but it won’t allow me to. I can’t progress, very annoying. Apparently I solved the agents problem wasting so much time here and there is no more storyline either...

Update: as I mentioned before I cant unlock think gravy-and. It is half cut off the screen and I can’t zoom out, nothing happens when I click on it. I have an iPad Pro 1st gen. I always update my iOS. The problem is still there. I’m stuck.

The text is way too small and hard to read and the controls are too fiddly for a mobile game.

Might be good on a computer but not on an iPad.
Not much depth

bought the bundle and was thinking “what did I just get myself into”.

I do not regret my purchase, it reminds me of ‘Game D Story’ with a pinch of ‘Word Chef’ where you can upgrade the workshop with rugs and wall decorations to boost team members.

The cheesy puns are delight, the art is good for a mobile device, the controls are simple, little instruction is needed. 

Keep up the good work. I hope you have more Holy Potatoes IPs in the works.
The game (Both) won’t advance past the tutorial...I nothing I do advanced the game and I’m stuck in an endless circle...I WANT MY MONEY BACK!!!!
I bought this game for my iPad and it won't get past the loading screen before crashing. I really want to play it but can't. Please fix the constant crashing
Really great game. Great devs. Really responsive to bug reporting!
I am stuck with the trying to pay for the people and restart the whole game over 15 or so times. Tips?

So pretty cool game, very much like game dev but instead you are a blacksmith (which is way cooler), only 4 stars though, the font is painfully small, unless you are playing on a large screen I highly recommend breaking out the bi-focals , seriously its impossibly small. Also be warned the game will chew through your battery pretty quickly, which isn’t the devs fault.

After about three hours I couldn’t take the repetition any longer. You could easily argue three hours of entertainment for five bucks is a steal, and I’d agree and happily support some talented devs, but I hope their next title has more variance.
Had great reviews but moves way too slow.  Not enjoyable at all.
It's as I said, it's very addicting and fun. I only have one issue, when I'm running the game at 3 times, even 2 times and it lags and then crashes.
Not able to unlock root beer island
Love this game but it isn't allowing me to unlock root beer island so the game won't progress. :(

I'm loving this game! Totally reminded me of Game Dev and this game borrowed some rpg elements like changing class jobs or whatever from the Kairosoft to make it a hundred times more addicting. 

I don't get why the potatoes are thrown into the game but it served as a comedic background in a bizarre way and doesn't really distract you from the main gameplay. Now, the gameplay is the best part because you go about forging weapons and strategically sell them to heroes for profit or fame. Next, you get the satisfaction from watching your business grow and being able to hire from a diversity of smiths to create more powerful weapons. I love how you can be in charge of managing smiths' skill classes too. 

My only complaints are that it doesn't come with the iCloud. You see the texts are kinda hard to read on my 7 plus but I imagine its worse for those with non-plus sized phones. However, I can read just fine on iPad, but iCloud would be nice to have for the ability to play on iPad at home and then switch to mobile on the road with my iPhone. The other is it could be a little more touch-screen intuitive for iPhones because it's somewhat annoying to try and tap on those darn, small arrows just to change the characters, actions, or exit to world map.  

That's only the only cons I can think of but the cons doesn't stop me from playing it. Otherwise, it's still a great port game!
Now that the crashing has been fixed this is an easy 5 stars.

Let me start by saying I love this game. It is fun, well balanced and addicting. BUT it has a major issue with crashing and the website link does not provide iOS support. Also the support link goes directly to the discord app with no instructions as to how to contact the developers. I want to play this game more but it crashes every time at the yearly awards and support is non existent or at least hidden.
crashed the game every time when the competition is coming! Please fix it!

title.label: Game crashed at Month 4 15th every year! Fix it pls!

content.label: Great game indeed. Bit this issue is just annoying and ruins all the fun, I had to save the game mannually. Hate it when I had so much fun and suddenly game crushed and after the reboot and reload the auto save the game keep crashing... And the worse thing is the last mannual save file was two hour ago……

After the update, this app has definitely redeemed itself. It's a great game that has kept my attention for long periods of time, which leads to questions like "Where did the hours go?" And "Why is my phone dying already?". I'm about halfway through the game, and I can only hope more will come. The buttons are still very small, and the game takes a little while to register taps. But those are my only complaints.

Wasn't sure which app to get as I didn't want to be stuck on one device, bought the iPhone as it claimed to be updated to universal but iPad has letterbox, animations are glitchy, resolution of different parts are horribly pixelated, certain objects have white lines around the transparency. All just rather upsetting.

Edit: It gets worse, crashes at first awards and can't get past it, crashes every time. Unplayable.
